snippet: On March 1, 1954, the Puerto Rican nationalists Lolita Lebron, Rafael Miranda, Irving Flores Rodriguez and Andres Figueroa Cordero entered the Capitol's House chamber and began firing at members of Congress, injuring five.
abstract: On March 1, 1954, the Puerto Rican nationalists Lolita Lebron, Rafael Miranda, Irving Flores Rodriguez and Andres Figueroa Cordero entered the Capitol's House chamber and began firing at members of Congress, injuring five.

headline.main: March 1, 1954 | Puerto Rican Nationalists Open Fire on House of Representatives
